required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Efficacy and Ocular Surface Disease Assessment Between Monoprost and BAK-preserved Latanoprost
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Efficacy and Ocular Surface Disease Assessment Between Monoprost and BAK-preserved Latanoprost in Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertensive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of Efficacy and Ocular Surface Disease Assessment Between Monoprost and BAK-preserved Latanoprost in Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertensive Patients : Phase 4, Parallel Group Design, Investigator-blind, Active-control, Randomized, Multi-center Study

primary_outcome.description: The degree of staining of the cornea after blue fluorescein staining under the light of cobalt blue using a yellow filter was evaluated according to the Oxford grading system (0 to 5, the higher the worse)
The conjunctiva was divided into 6 areas and evaluated after the same staining method according to the Oxford grading system (0 to 3, the higher the worse)
The ocular surface was assessed using OSDI scoring questionnaire (0 to 100, the higher the worse)
Compliance of the drug administration has been check through the subject's self description (0 to 100, the higher the better)

secondary_outcome.description: The degree of staining of the cornea after blue fluorescein staining under the light of cobalt blue using a yellow filter was evaluated according to the Oxford grading system(0 to 5, the higher the worse)
The conjunctiva was divided into 6 areas and evaluated after the same staining method according to the Oxford grading system (0 to 3, the higher the worse)
The ocular surface was assessed using OSDI scoring questionnaire(0 to 100, the higher the worse)
IOP was measured using Goldmann applanation tonometry and measured in mmHg. (numerical)
The time taken from the last blink to the appearance of a black spot on the cornea after fluorescein dye staining. (second, numerical)
The conjunctival hyperemia was assessed using Efron grading scales (0 to 4, the higher the worse)

arm_group.description: latanoprost : 1 drop once a day for 12 weeks to target eyes
latanoprost : 1 drop once a day for 12 weeks to target eyes

intervention.description: preservative-free latanoprost 1 drop once a day for 12 weeks to target eyes
preserved latanoprost 1 drop once a day for 12 weeks to target eyes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- IOP >/= 15mmHg and < 40 mmHg in each eye using Goldmann applanation tonometry at visit 2
- Written consent voluntarily to participate in this clinical trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with closed-angle, congenital glaucoma or secondary glaucoma caused by steroid drugs, etc.
- best-corrected visual acuity 20/80 or less
- Patients who have ongoing medical history of ocular inflammation
- central corneal thickness is not in between 470um and 591um.
- Patients who have received lacrimal duct procedure within the last 3 months or who have plans to have it.
- pregnant or nursing women
